title: Cuntz algebra
summary: In mathematics, the Cuntz algebra O n {\displaystyle {\mathcal {O}}_{n}} , named after Joachim Cuntz, is the universal C*-algebra generated by n {\displaystyle n} isometries of an infinite-dimensional Hilbert space H {\displaystyle {\mathcal {H}}} satisfying certain relations.[1] These algebras were introduced as the first concrete examples of a separable infinite simple C*-algebra, meaning as a Hilbert space, O n {\displaystyle {\mathcal {O}}_{n}} is isometric to the sequence space
